reviews.text: stay at ITC Mughal for one night only for visiting Taj Mahal. The hotel has great location and beautiful facility. Restaurant has great food. However, the most impotant is the way it treats guests. Since I lost my luggage coming to India, the hotel was able to do a complementary lanudary with 4 hours turn around. Sanjay, the GM, also tried hard to help me retrieve the luggage from airline after finding out my problem. Definitely recommend it to all my friends.
reviews.title: great property at historic location and great management

reviews.text: i stopped in agra to visit taj mahal. i stayed there for 1 nite…it's a budget travel and supposed to find a hostel but couldnt really find an ideal one. finally , we booked ITC and i think i made a good choice. bf is tasty, service was good and i got upgraded to suite, and it's close to taj mahal.
reviews.title: no better choice
Nice rooms - amazing spa
reviews.text: I have seen some comments below saying that the rooms were old and in need of refurbishment. I think I would agree with those comments and add that while clean the rooms were not spotless and shining as perhaps they might be. They are nice rooms though, just a bit old really and it has the feel of the excess of an age of the first really bling hotels which has only been partly refurbished.
The spa is brand new however and is rated as the finest she has ever been in by my girlfriend. I just sat by the pool which I found pleasant enough.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a bit of an issue with the staff not being as perfectly helpful as they might be though. I don't mean this in the sense that they do not care but rather that they are a bit too happy to stick you in a hotel car or something rather than answering your question. We were heading out on two occasions as a taxi was dropping people off and the staff refused to allow us to grab the taxi as it was heading out as they wanted to call one themselves - bizarre really as we just walked outside and grabbed a tok tok. Also the hotel guy tried to convince me to use him to bring us to the taj first thing at 7am ( we wanted to go at 6.30 but he was already booked), even though I told him I wanted to be there for sunrise, rather than just helping organise someone to bring us at the time we wanted. Not on really that he is trying to persuade people away from going when they want to so that they can line their pockets.
reviews.title: Rooms desperately need a refurbishment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Jan 2013 at this hotel.. It was a lovely experience at the hotel.. After a long drive in Fog from Delhi we arrived late at this hotel.. Luckily we were upgraded to Mughal Suite Room.. And as the name says its truly a Mughal Delight.. All the stress was gone looking at the room & ambience.. The feel of the room was very beautiful.. Worth the price & value.. Very near to Taj as well... Overall experience was good..
reviews.title: A Beautiful Stay!!

reviews.text: The entrance and the lobby was beautiful! You can feel a sense of luxury. The interiors were up to date and modern. However, this hotel needs to be managed well! The courtyard needs some serious gardening although that was not the highlight of this hotel. It still feels luxurious but needs to be managed well. Would definitely book again here if I'm gonna see the Taj Mahal again for the second time. :-)
reviews.title: A Grand Entrance

reviews.text: Stayed at the ITC Agra Feb 25th while visiting the Taj. What a great stay. The front desk staff was amazing and so helpful. I loved this property. The rooms were spacious, very clean, and very upscale. The service here was the best I had in all my travels throughout India. The staff needs to be commended on their quality of providing great service.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a Moghul suite we got through Expedia. The welcome was very nice although we got a few too many knocks on the door in the first half hour.
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.text: Suite was very good and although the comments about the hotel needing a refurb are true, our room was very good. Bed comfortable, best aircon we had in India. Everything we needed.
reviews.title: Impeccable house keeping services!!

reviews.text: The ITC is a luxury hotel in Agra. We had a large room, with enough space for an extra bed, and a nice bathroom. Everything was clean. The kids enjoyed the pool very much, and all the great gardens and outdoor spaces that aren't commonly found at Indian hotels, in our experience. The breakfast, which was included in our room price, was outstanding. A great mix of Western and Indian food, and the service was outstanding. It seemed nothing was impossible! We ate at Peshawar restaurant in the hotel and while it was nice, it was overpriced for similar food in Delhi. The hotel dinner buffet was much better value.
reviews.title: Posh, but what does it all mean?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can glimpse the Taj from the roof but it is a poor view. Much more interesting is to watch the pigeon fanciers training their pigeons from the rooftops of nearby houses at dusk.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Exceptionally Well-Run Hotel

reviews.text: My one beef with the hotel was the constant demand, on the part of the staff, for tips. (This comment excludes the excellent hostesses at the front desk.) One example: during the day, my son's extra bed was unmade and the bedclothes stored away. Each night, the "room boy" would come and set up the extra bed again. And wait for a tip. Even when he had to wait a long time because I was giving my son a bath! Because of the way that the signal lights near the door function (these are outside the room door), staff can tell that you are in there and believe me, the room boy never came when we were at dinner. Before we vacated the room, another "room boy" appeared and demanded a tip. Others downstairs wanted tips for loading the luggage onto our car (we had brought the luggage downstairs). I could go on and on. While we would have tipped as a matter of course, I found it offensive to be subject to these demands all the time.
reviews.title: Crap service in an upclass setting.

reviews.text: This situation is NOT the fault of the people working at the hotel. Rather, it is the fault of the hotel management that they do not pay their employees enough so that they have to resort to what amounts to begging. If the management considered the comfort of the guests, they would realize that it is a hassle to always have change on hand to pay their workers. At other hotels we stayed at, a final tip was given to all the staff, and this was divided among them. It was at these places where we had the best, most genuine service, and the most enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Place to be in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with this hotel in all respects. As Starwood Platinum members, we were upgraded to a beautiful suite, even though we were using points for our stay. We were also treated like royalty. A butler, Trevor, was assigned to us and he anticipated our every need, escorting us to the dining room and pool, keeping the suite pristine, suggesting a departure time to view the Taj at sunrise, etc. We had dinner at Peshawari and thought the food and service were excellent. We loved the spa facility and its separate pool, which was terrific for long-distance continuous swimming. We were very glad that we did not opt to spend $500+ per night at the Oberoi simply to have a close view of the Taj. The Mughal has a viewing platform but this really isn't necessary since you will be going there anyway! All in all, this was a great hotel!
reviews.title: You can't get a better personlised stay than what ITC Mughal offers..

reviews.title: Excellent Service

likes.liked: — The service was excellent. Hotel staff was really friendly and supportive. We were arranging a conferene there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, we had a fantastic room (no Taj view- but we didnt miss it a second) and everything was very clean and tidy. Loved the pillows and proper duvet that we were given, it made a great change to the blankets we had in other hotels. The hotel makes you forget that you are in India - which actually can make for a nice break after travelling the country for a while. The spa is beautiful, the pool area as well. Food in the Indian restaurant is really good and we can certainly recommend it. We found all staff very helpful and service was great. If you are staying in Agra - which in my view is an appalling city - then this is a great hotel to stay in for a night or two.
reviews.title: Very occidental and a great place to recharge

reviews.text: One of the best hotels in Agra if not the one. The rooms are nice and spacious. Though need a little touch up. The entire compund is fantastic with a lot of things to do. The Spa on the property is truly a marvel and makes the hotel worth a visit just for that. Truly amazing. Lots of things to do for the kids and a great place to hang out. The bar is rather unispiring. Also the resteraunts on the hotel property are really over pricey and worth a pass. Though the breakfast is elaborate and top notch.Also the pillow menu they have is very good. Overall a great place to stay when on a visit to Agra.
reviews.title: Good Hotel. Great Service

reviews.text: A hotel with all the facilities under one rood and a excelent spa. I recommend this hotel for Young singles, An amazing honeymoon, A romantic getaway, Girlfriend getaway, People with disabilities, Older travelers, Great pool scene, Families with young children, Tourists.We were visiting the golden triangle with our kids and this place was suggested by our travel agent. We reached in mid afternoon and both our kids were suffering from upset stomach. When we reached our room it was very spacious and the extra bed was already there which was very comforting. We requested the room service to make khichiri, a rice and pulse porridge for our kids they just complied, though it was not in their menu. That was really touching. The hotel itself is very close to Taj and you can actually seen it from the roof. The hotel has a lot of greenery and feeling of openness.The restaurant is awesome with wonderful spread. In all it was a pleasant experience.

reviews.text: Unfortunately, on your way to the room you are back to reality! The corridor walk evokes visions of a totally different world: a world of old carpets cut in 3m-length pieces, visibly unglued, creating bumps in the center; a world of narrow staircases and scratched doors of house keeping sections...

reviews.text: We stayed at ITC Mughal Agra in first week of March. The spring was in full bloom. We had a warm welcome by very lively staff. Rooms were excellent. Breakfast Buffet was very nice specially the Indian foods. Our 3 nights stay was very comfortable.

reviews.title: Awful customer experience
reviews.text: We stayed in March 2013 with two adults and two children for three nights. The rooms were very clean, comfortable, wifi worked well. We enjoyed both the full-service Indian restaurant and the buffet restaurant on the ground floor where breakfast is also served. The buffet for lunch and dinner (between 1000 - 1500 INR per person with kids half price) includes Indian, European and Chinese cuising - great for our family. Location is good for visiting Taj Mahal and Agra town. There are several stalls on the road outside and three banks with ATMs on the other side of the road within 5 mins walk. There is a recreation room on the ground floor (two hotel rooms) with a table tennis table and a pool table. And the pool is well-appointed (though service not at all attentive; you have to try hard to get a drink!).

reviews.title: Excellent stay
reviews.text: On the first night we slept terribly as there was a conference on and in the room above ours there were six men up all night moving around, and the furniture (with no felt feet) screeched terribly on the hard floor every time they moved a chair or table. At 1 am I asked them to keep it down a bit as they had woken us and our kids, which the guests promised to do but then didn't. OK we fully understand that there is a different acceptability of noise in India than in Europe (say). But it is no good to us to pay for an expensive hotel and then not get a decent night's sleep. We spoke with the hotel management the next morning, and were told that either the guests would be moved to a different room or they would get their written confirmation that they would not move furniture around at night. The duty manager gave me his personal assurance - "I guarantee you that you will sleep well tonight". We were told that it would not be possible (or necessary) for us to move rooms.

reviews.title: Great location, excellent spa
reviews.text: At midnight we were woken again by the same guests, same furniture screeching. Evidently neither commitment from the duty manager had been honoured, as also confirmed to us by teh night duty manager. We insisted on moving rooms immediately, which was then done to a junior suite where an extra bed was put in. The next morning the lock on that door ceased to work (the electronics were broken), so we were out of a room again. We were pretty frustrated by now, and when the guest relations manager said "I give you my personal assurance....." we were less than trusting after sleeping 2hrs on night 1 and 5 hrs on night 2.

reviews.title: Beautiful property with a feeling of luxury ...
reviews.text: When we returned in the evening we had been upgraded to a lovely suite, in which we spent 10 hours of which 8 were sleeping (by this stage we would probably have slept well in the garden...).
